text: he uh first and foremost um brings a
very very uh complex study of The Human
Condition and he can make you laugh and
he can make you cry and he can make you
um consider uh political realities in
new ways and um so and he never dies
it's always relevant um
but for me what was important about
Shakespeare was uh the fact that that it
all was in the words it was all all the
action was in the words
um um all of the humanity he was trying
to share was in the words and in fact
you know in words that were designed in
a certain way so I was interested in the
design of Shakespeare's words and how
that design led to um anybody saying
those words a deeper understanding a
profound and deep understanding about
the human being they were portraying and
in fact that led me directly to thinking
that if I were to study the words of a
so-called common walking man and and
treat it and study it the way that I
treated and studied Shakespeare that I
would find something inside of a what
we'd call a commonplace person which
could be on the stage and not really in
that way that you say truth is Stranger
Than Fiction but that someone in the
course of an hour would come upon
something um that was so meaningful to
them that it could be heroic and that it
could uh capture the attention of an
audience and so uh pretty much you know
uh Shakespeare led me right to my
experiment what I had was a
question um that occupied me for a very
long time so I can tell you what the
question was and I could tell you that
even as I still practice around that
question it led it's led me to another
question that um uh I don't even know
how to work on but the question I've
been trying to answer uh since the first
time I ever picked up a Shakespearean
text U to speak it under the Gaze of a
an authority on Shakespeare I mean you
know I'd spoken some Shakespearean words
in other informal ways but the first
time anybody was sort of ever listening
to me attempt to speak in Shakespeare uh
was in
1970 two or something like that and so
the question that came from that was
what is the relationship of language to
Identity and that question has occupied
me for a long time and now I have a new
question which is what is the gap
between understanding and action and
what does it take to bridge that Gap and
I don't know the answer to it and that's
why that's the question that I suspect
will occupy me now for some years
